intro: Heliophila cornuta var. cornuta, commonly known as the spiked heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, upright stems with small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slight fragrance, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds.
